bio: Iâ€™m a Computer Science Student at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. Over the years, Iâ€™ve been doing robotics, participating in competitions, and interning at tech companies. I specialize in software, but I'm also experienced in developing autonomy sensing, intermediate PCB Design, and hardware design (CAD). When Iâ€™m not on the job, I love doing sports, working my way through every episode of the new show I'm watching, and indulging in my love for outdoor activities. If youâ€™d like to contact me, please reach out via email (benliangcs@gmail.com).

1.name: Guider Tech Internship
1.description: Participated in regular meetings and discussions among engineers and the marketing team. Tested smartwatch performance on autonomy sensing and data optimization. Collected smartwatch sensor data. Trained/developed machine learning models, boosted accuracy to 87.68% by tuning the feature processing and model parameters through Python, data collection, and cross-validation.

2.name: Delta Robotics
2.description: Taught 20+ students how to program robots in C++ & Python, including computer vision (OpenCV), various BUS protocols, software-hardware integration, and robotics programming. Developed motherboards for use in competitions, demonstrations, and other projects. Learned how to prepare lessons and impart knowledge effectively.

3.name: Zero2One
3.description: Incubator program that selected members via a competitive application and interview process. Exploring and applying concepts such as prototyping, branding, and project management, but also technical skills including AI, Python, and various software development tools. Along with equally passionate peers to dive into the field of entrepreneurship. Create and develop our own projects/start-ups, seeking to obtain venture capital and cooperate with various accelerators/companies. (Explores app development and website building).

4.name: NOBE (National Organization of Business and Engineering)
4.description: Carries out business and engineering consulting. Research and develop solutions according to clientsâ€™ needs and create our own entrepreneurial projects. Dives into concepts related to AI, AWS, and data analysis. NOBE is a registered non-profit organization seeking to bridge the gap for those interested in business and engineering. The Technology Committee specifically works on and with industry tools and technology, as well as APIs and various servers.

5.name: Engineering Council
5.description: As a member of the Technical Committee, we develop innovative projects (Websites, Apps, Research) and eventually display them at the Engineering Open House (EOH). But as members of the Engineering Council, we also promote UIUCâ€™s engineering to future engineers.

6.name: ACM (Association for Computing Machinery)
6.description: Joined the GameBuilders, SIGMobile, SIGPwny interest groups. Learn to develop games, apps, and basic cyber security procedures, using Godot Engine, flutter/dart, and python (basic reverse engineering, web hacking, and basic cyper securtiy procedures).

7.name: RoboCup Junior Soccer
7.description: Led Taiwan Robotics Team to compete against 50 international teams in the RoboCup Junior Soccer Competition. Researched and taught computer/machine vision, Deep Learning/Machine Learning, autonomy sensing, and robotics programming. Developed autonomous circular robots that moved on all axes, kicked, dribbled, and played soccer competitively. Programmed robots using C++ and Python.

1.name: Internship Website, Project Lead
1.description: Created a website that is able to scrap data from the web according to filters and specifications regarding common internship qualifications and options. The website is currently in its fine-tuning stages.

2.name: Alphabet Game, Project Lead
2.tech_stack_used: Tech Stack: C++ and Godot IDE
2.description: Created an adventure game centered around the alphabet â€˜Gâ€™ finding various letters and completing puzzle-like stages. Utilized the Godot IDE and C++ to program the game. Supports advanced character physics and character-to-environment interactions.

3.name: Line Bot
3.tech_stack_used: Tech Stack: Python and Line API
3.description: Wrote a chat bot for a popular social media app in Taiwan. The chat bot had several different functions, including web crawling for the products you want to buy, giving you detailed information on the metro, such as the depart times, which station you should depart from, and the different options you have if you want to get to a particular destination.

4.name: Machine Learning Project
4.description: Programmed and trained a machine learning model where it can identify and output handwritten words, letters, and numbers. The accuracy acheived was 85% and was improved via self-generated data, online data bases, and cross validation. The program can even identify letters and numbers from street signs and car plates.

1.description: RoboCup Junior Individual Championship 2021                                    -> Competed against 50 international teams in the RoboCup Junior Soccer Competition. Had to win the national compeititon to reach this stage. Developed autonomous circular robots that moved on all axes, kicked, dribbled, and played soccer competitively. Programmed robots using C++ and Python.

2.description: RoboCup Junior International SuperTeam Championship June 2019 & June 2021                               -> Competed against 8 SuperTeams teams in the RoboCup Junior Soccer Competition. 3-4 Countries form a SuperTeam, each team contribute 1-2 robots, and we compete on a enlarged field. We were the captain team and we had to devise brand new strategies and change our programs/robots on the spot to allow every robot to work seamlessly together.

3.description: National Innovation Award                                      -> Competed alongside Temple Health, an AI precision health company. Responsible for gathering data from smart watches the company made and using that data to help formulate algorithms and train Machine Learning models. Helped research and brainstorm implications and specific medical conditions related to the project (heart diseases, diabetes, and more).
